definition: to need to answer the call of nature

sentences.english: Today, I was driving to work and I had to pee really badly.
sentences.chinese: 今天，我开车去上班，有点内急。
裤子拉锁在哪儿？我内急。

sentences.english: People often become incontinent when they get very old.
sentences.chinese: 人老了就往往有内急失禁现象。

sentences.english: There is a passenger inside nasty, urinate urgently to diarrhea, request the driver to stop.
sentences.chinese: 有一乘客内急，实在憋不住要拉稀，请求司机停车。

sentences.english: He got caught short suddenly and had a wee behind a car.
sentences.chinese: 他突然内急，于是在车后面小便。

definition: (jocularly) to need to answer the call of nature
to relieve oneself (i.e. use the toilet)/to solve
to defecate (euphemism)/to go to the toilet
to pee pee (kiddie or feminine slang)
to pass water/to piss/to urinate/to wee wee
to block up (a road, pipe etc)/to stop up (a hole)/(fig.) (of a person) choked up with anxiety or stress/wall (literary)/(classifier for walls)
quick witted in an emergency/able to react resourcefully
